People who have not installed Borderlands prior to downloading this torrent might get the following error when running Borderlands.exe:

"This application failed to start because the configuration of the application is incorrect, reinstalling might solve the problem."

To fix this, people will need to install the Microsoft Visual C++ 2005 Redistributable from here:  http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?FamilyId=32BC1BEE-A3F9-4C13-9C99-220B62A191EE&displaylang=en

Then you might as well patch to SP1 here:  http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/info.aspx?na=47&p=2&SrcDisplayLang=en&SrcCategoryId=&SrcFamilyId=32bc1bee-a3f9-4c13-9c99-220b62a191ee&u=details.aspx%3ffamilyid%3d200B2FD9-AE1A-4A14-984D-389C36F85647%26displaylang%3den

If an "application configuration is incorrect" error still occurrs, then install the x64 version of the above links:  http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/info.aspx?na=47&p=4&SrcDisplayLang=en&SrcCategoryId=&SrcFamilyId=32bc1bee-a3f9-4c13-9c99-220b62a191ee&u=details.aspx%3ffamilyid%3d90548130-4468-4BBC-9673-D6ACABD5D13B%26displaylang%3den

And SP1 for the x64 version: http://www.microsoft.com/downloads/details.aspx?familyid=EB4EBE2D-33C0-4A47-9DD4-B9A6D7BD44DA&displaylang=en

Hopefully someone will read this instead of asking.

There is no installer needed for this to work.  You just need to have the correct framework installed, at least DirectX 9.0c, and that's it.  For software requirements at least.

If you are experiencing crashes all the time, or can't get into the game, google your error.  There are posts on numerous workarounds on Gearbox's forums.  AMD Phenom processors require a workaround.  Certain older multi-core CPU's require a workaround (run the game, immediately open task manager, right-click on Borderlands.exe in the Processes tab, Set Affinity, CPU 1).

This game will not run well on older machines.  There are many different things you can try, but this is a somewhat GPU-intensive game.

This torrent works, and saves people like me hours of explaining file replacement during installation to technically-challeneged friends.  Thanks again Arctic!  Post your SPECIFIC errors here and I will try to help, people!

Include the exact file paths, take out your username if you want.

cl4ptp: I still don't get what you're "installing"?  This torrent doesn't require any installation (so long as you have DirectX 9.0c and the Visual C++ 2005 SP1 x86 Redist installed).  You just extract the folder to... say... your desktop.  Try this:

1) Uninstall BL and delete all BL folders that are left over from any other installations.
2) Copy the C:\Documents and Settings\YOUR-USERNAME\My Documents\My Games\Borderlands folder to your desktop.  Delete the original.
3) Extract this torrent.  Move the Borderlands folder within this torrent to C:\Program Files\
4) Try running C:\Program Files\Borderlands\Binaries\Engine.exe

I hope this helps!  If not, what games do you play that don't crash on that machine?

kullik357: try disabling your Realtek High Definition Audio device in Device Manager, then see if it keeps crashing.  If not, you've found one of the incompatibilities with the game.  If so, re-enable and follow the steps in the sticky on the Gearbox Forums' Borderlands PC tech support forum: http://gbxforums.gearboxsoftware.com/showthread.php?t=89763

AuRTeam: You said "It comes with a verified serial key" when trying to get people to download the other torrent.  Borderlands has no serial.  I don't know why you're trying to hype a download that is over a gig larger than this one for the same thing, but stop it, and stop lying.
Yes, well considering that Borderlands from Steam doesn't use reg keys, serial keys, or any kind of key, I don't understand why you are trying to promote another torrent that has these...

To fix the following issues:

1. XINPUT1_3.dll is missing
-Go into the Folder: Borderlands/Prerequisites then run DXSETUP

2. "Physxcudart_20.dll was not found"
- Go into the Folder: Borderlands/Prerequisites 
and run PhysX_8.10.29_SystemSoftware

I was having the same issues, then I ran those two and now my game runs perfectly.

If you get the incorrect configuration error, apparently you need C++, or something that you get from installing a real Blands copy.
